content: A box contains 6 red balls and 5 blue balls. If you pick one ball without looking, what is the probability it will be red?
subject: Thinking Skills
explanation: There are 6 red balls out of 11 total balls, so the probability is 6/11.

content: If all cats are animals, and Charlie is a cat, what can we conclude?
subject: Thinking Skills
explanation: Since all cats are animals and Charlie is a cat, Charlie must be an animal.

content: A farmer has chickens and rabbits. He counts 10 heads and 26 legs. How many chickens are there?
subject: Thinking Skills
explanation: If all were chickens: 10×2=20 legs. Extra legs: 26-20=6. Each rabbit adds 2 extra legs, so 3 rabbits. Therefore 10-3=7 chickens.

content: A box contains 8 red balls and 3 blue balls. If you pick one ball without looking, what is the probability it will be red?
subject: Thinking Skills
explanation: There are 8 red balls out of 11 total balls, so the probability is 8/11.

content: A farmer has chickens and rabbits. He counts 11 heads and 34 legs. How many chickens are there?
subject: Thinking Skills
explanation: If all were chickens: 11×2=22 legs. Extra legs: 34-22=12. Each rabbit adds 2 extra legs, so 6 rabbits. Therefore 11-6=5 chickens.
